items.sentence: I don\'t think we\'ll ever know what happened to Tom.
I don\'t understand why you and Tom don\'t get along.
I don\'t want to think about what could\'ve happened.
Tom said he didn\'t have to worry about Mary anymore.
Tom said he didn\'t know what Mary wanted him to buy.
Tom said he didn\'t know when Mary would be arriving.
Tom said he didn\'t know where he was supposed to go.
Tom said he didn\'t see anything out of the ordinary.
Tom said he didn\'t think Mary was really a Canadian.
In America, cars drive on the right side of the road.
In those days, I used to get up at six every morning.
It cost me one thousand yen to get the bicycle fixed.
Are you seriously thinking about buying that old car?
Are you seriously thinking about selling this online?
Buildings are much stronger now than they used to be.
Could you please tell me again where you put the key?
Could you translate this document into French for me?
It was a long war because neither side would give in.
It was hard for Tom to get his homework done on time.
Lightning does sometimes strike the same place twice.
